sentences: Sõduril oli seljas mõõga ja kilp.
context: The Estonian word 'mõõga' is the partitive case form of 'mõõk', meaning sword or blade. It refers to a cold weapon used by military officers, particularly in parade formations. The partitive case indicates partiality or indefiniteness - so this could mean 'a piece/some of the sword' or it could be used with other nouns to indicate possession or accompaniment.
